Key Match Events: Gavin Lux drew a walk and Kiké Hernández scorching a single against Padres starter Dylan Cease to generate traffic
Will Smith drove a fastball a projected 432 feet to center field
Tommy Edman executed a well-executed squeeze bunt up the first-base line
Lux turned on the first changeup he saw from Wandy Peralta for a home run
The Dodgers set the stage by chasing Cease after just 38 pitches
Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman's sprained right ankle needs weeks to heal
Mookie Betts, mired in a mental funk just days ago amid a history of October struggles, gave the Dodgers their second first-inning homer in as many nights
Shohei Ohtani and Betts expanded the lead to 3-0 an inning later
The bottom five spots in the batting order combined to go 10-for-51 through the first three games of this series
Teoscar Hernández sliding up to Freeman’s spot in the order Wednesday, the six hitters that followed combined to go 7-for-25
Post-Match Reflections: When you get into the postseason, it’s a street fight
It’s about people, players, and your desire has got to be more than your opponent
They can thank a collective offensive effort
That,” Smith said, “is just who we are
Facing elimination without their top star, the Dodgers will see a winner-take-all game on Friday night
I don’t know what it says, honestly dude
We were very injured all year, somehow we had the best record in the league. I feel like tonight was an example of what this team is capable of doing
Miscellaneous Highlights: Freeman’s sprained right ankle needs weeks to heal
A bone bruise in the foot added to the agony
His side aches
Injections and treatment have allowed him to start and finish nine innings just once as the Dodgers have battled the San Diego Padres in this National League Division Series
Each game appearance by him has taken hours to put the first baseman back together again
Max Muncy endured an arduous summer
He missed months for an oblique injury that was supposed to last days
A visit to a chiropractor, of all people, cured his discomfort but only after multiple visits
And yet, on a check swing Tuesday, he appeared to aggravate matters all over again
Through his first 13 at-bats, he chased outside of the zone
He swung recklessly
Valued for his patience at the plate, he didn’t look like himself. Until he did
Then there’s Smith, whose yearslong struggles against fastballs had cut into the profile of one of the most prolific offensive catchers in the sport
He found life against them 13 days ago, driving the two-run shot off a fastball that helped the Dodgers topple these Padres for the NL West crown
Smith connected
Edman filled in for Rojas after the veteran shortstop aggravated his torn adductor in Game 3, shifting from center field to shortstop
The utility man has fit everything the Dodgers love
The switch-hitter had struggled mightily from the left side of the plate
With the right-handed Alek Jacob on the mound and an opportunity to build on the Dodgers’ lead, he contemplated bunting
Roberts agreed
Lux, the would-be shortstop who lost his job two weeks before Opening Day, was kept around for his bat but sat with a.562 OPS at the All-Star break
For years, the former top prospect bounced between offensive identities
A torn ACL and defensive woes cost him a job in consecutive years
So Lux just decided to swing harder, and more aggressively
Like a hitter capable of swings like the one he unleashed Wednesday
Lux posted an.899 OPS after the break
He’s tied for the team’s lead in hits through four postseason games
Kiké Hernández. The Dodgers re-signed him this offseason with an eye on October but he didn’t log his first 2024 playoff start until the Dodgers faced elimination
He didn’t play at all in Game 3, even as the Dodgers climbed back to within a run of an early deficit
But in Game 4, the longtime utility man bounced from third base to center field and back, collecting two hits on the night
